content.description: Fun line with awesome finish. Left of cove starts in corner near, guano. Great knobs and buckets to start - move right over bulge - mantle - slab to headwall where the fun begins. 4,5 moves of steep but solid grabs as the gym kids say gets you to a brilliant long final throw for the anchors. Bask.

Start on good holds moving left - midway up after 3rd clip (? going from memory, sorry) dicey move to solid holds watch the tree to your back, this is the PG13. Stays thin but well featured and a bold & blind final move to anchors.
content.location: Left of cove proper is a gully, this one starts on the left side of the gully. Technically the Southern-most route at the Peaks, if I'm not mistaken. :)

content.description:
If you accidentally sleep walk carrying trad gear this far you may find yourself wanting to explore 'Dream Signals'. Actually quite a good piece of mini stone (50'; lying down) that features great quality dacite crack climbing. Classic; if only it were twice as long. 

  Start up a no worries slab and towards the crack. Find good gear in the tips seam and follow the widening and overhanging crack up. Bring a #5 for the good times above.
content.location: 10+ minutes down from The Peaks main area, a little further beyond Beyond. Starts in a mini amphitheater with a slab below. Gully below route will take you directly back down towards main approach trail.

content.description: Left inside of cove starts on a boulder on ledges to slopers. Second clip can be a doozie so stick-clip if you didn't eat your Wheaties! Third (?) Clip is dicey too, balance required, remember to breathe. From here move right through some hidden holds & edges setting up for proud prow finish. (Undercling somewhere up there before moving left then finish right.) Sink a bucket for a Hero's ending!
content.location: Left inside of Cove starts on boulder.

content.description:
Crux up high. Nice easy climbing on great holds down low, WATCH THE BLOCK! Move gingerly to a slab with fun moves to a mini head wall with thin hidden holds and great protection to a right sided finish to Anchors on the huge block. 

  NOTE: The  upper block needs to be re-assessed for Long term TR use now that area is open to the public so please do not TR this route for your own safety off this block! Also the lower block could use some re-evaluating as per new public use, tread lightly!
content.location: Right side of cove just left of cave.

content.description: Somewhat shady belays in a cozy cove.
